TypeSignature.Value: public delegate void ItemChangedEventHandler(object sender, ItemChangedEventArgs e);
.class public auto ansi sealed ItemChangedEventHandler extends System.MulticastDelegate

Docs.param: An that contains the event data.
Docs.summary: Represents the method that will handle the event of the class.

remarks.format: ## Remarks When you create an <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ItemChangedEventHandler> delegate, you identify the method that will handle the event. To associate the event with your event handler, add an instance of the delegate to the event. The event handler is called whenever the event occurs, unless you remove the delegate. For more information about event handler delegates, see [Events](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/b6f65241-e0ad-4590-a99f-200ce741bb1f).
